TopicTitle: Direction of orbits; Is there a mod?

Articles.Content:
The orbit required for satellite on contracts shows the direction. Is there a mod that makes all existing orbits show the direction as well?

For rendezvous mission I find it sometimes hard to figure out which direction it is going.
There isn't. It would probably have to be custom, because I think satellite target orbits are a different bit in the code.
About all you can do is watch the map. Warp at 5x for a few seconds and you should be able to tell.
You can also compare the time to the Ap and Pe, that should give you an idea of which way you're going. But that only really works with the focused ship.
Most should be counter clockwise wise
Click on your orbit like you're placing a maneuver node. It should tell you the time to the place you clicked. Click on either side of your location, taaa da.

> 
> Most should be counter clockwise wise

Not the polar orbits.

But your point is a good one. For equatorial orbits, you are normally going to put the objects in orbit the same direction as the planet rotates. At least I do. It seems to be some kind of unwritten rule. The reason for this is any ship launching from the surface wants to orbit this way, because it requires less dV.
No need. There's a subtle little animation that whips around the target orbit if you watch it a bit. The direction it moves is the direction of the orbit.

> 
> No need. There's a subtle little animation that whips around the target orbit if you watch it a bit. The direction it moves is the direction of the orbit.

True for when the orbit itself is the contract; I believe the OP wants to rendezvous with another ship, in which case you can't tell which direction the target ship is orbiting at a glance.
